member.name: T:SampSharp.GameMode.BaseMode
member.summary: Base class for a SA-MP game mode.

member.name: E:SampSharp.GameMode.BaseMode.Initialized
member.summary: Occurs when the callback is being called. This callback is triggered when the gamemode starts.

member.name: E:SampSharp.GameMode.BaseMode.Exited
member.summary: Occurs when the callback is being called. This callback is called when a gamemode ends.

member.name: E:SampSharp.GameMode.BaseMode.PlayerConnected
member.summary: Occurs when the callback is being called. This callback is called when a player connects to the server.

member.name: E:SampSharp.GameMode.BaseMode.PlayerDisconnected
member.summary: Occurs when the callback is being called. This callback is called when a player disconnects from the server.

member.name: E:SampSharp.GameMode.BaseMode.PlayerCleanup
member.summary: Occurs when the callback is being called. This callback is called after a player has disconnected.
member.remarks: Because probably is the first listener of this event, the object is already disposed before any other listeners are called. It is better to either use the event or

member.name: E:SampSharp.GameMode.BaseMode.PlayerSpawned
member.summary: Occurs when the callback is being called. This callback is called when a player spawns.

member.name: E:SampSharp.GameMode.BaseMode.PlayerDied
member.summary: Occurs when the callback is being called. This callback is triggered when the gamemode starts.

member.name: E:SampSharp.GameMode.BaseMode.VehicleSpawned
member.summary: Occurs when the callback is being called. This callback is called when a vehicle respawns.

member.name: E:SampSharp.GameMode.BaseMode.VehicleDied
member.summary: Occurs when the callback is being called. This callback is called when a vehicle is destroyed - either by exploding or becoming submerged in water.
member.remarks: This callback will also be called when a vehicle enters water, but the vehicle can be saved from destruction by teleportation or driving out (if only partially submerged). The callback won't be called a second time, and the vehicle may disappear when the driver exits, or after a short time.

member.name: E:SampSharp.GameMode.BaseMode.PlayerText
member.summary: Occurs when the callback is being called. Called when a player sends a chat message.

member.name: E:SampSharp.GameMode.BaseMode.PlayerCommandText
member.summary: Occurs when the callback is being called. This callback is called when a player enters a command into the client chat window, e.g. /help.

member.name: E:SampSharp.GameMode.BaseMode.PlayerRequestClass
member.summary: Occurs when the callback is being called. Called when a player changes class at class selection (and when class selection first appears).

member.name: E:SampSharp.GameMode.BaseMode.PlayerEnterVehicle
member.summary: Occurs when the callback is being called. This callback is called when a player starts to enter a vehicle, meaning the player is not in vehicle yet at the time this callback is called.

member.name: E:SampSharp.GameMode.BaseMode.PlayerExitVehicle
member.summary: Occurs when the callback is being called. This callback is called when a player exits a vehicle.
member.remarks: Not called if the player falls off a bike or is removed from a vehicle by other means such as setting .

member.name: E:SampSharp.GameMode.BaseMode.PlayerStateChanged
member.summary: Occurs when the callback is being called. This callback is called when a player exits a vehicle.
member.remarks: Not called if the player falls off a bike or is removed from a vehicle by other means such as setting .

member.name: E:SampSharp.GameMode.BaseMode.PlayerEnterCheckpoint
member.summary: Occurs when the callback is being called. This callback is called when a player enters the checkpoint set for that player.

member.name: E:SampSharp.GameMode.BaseMode.PlayerLeaveCheckpoint
member.summary: Occurs when the callback is being called. This callback is called when a player leaves the checkpoint set for that player.

member.name: E:SampSharp.GameMode.BaseMode.PlayerEnterRaceCheckpoint
member.summary: Occurs when the callback is being called. This callback is called when a player enters a race checkpoint.

member.name: E:SampSharp.GameMode.BaseMode.PlayerLeaveRaceCheckpoint
member.summary: Occurs when the callback is being called. This callback is called when a player leaves the race checkpoint.

member.name: E:SampSharp.GameMode.BaseMode.RconCommand
member.summary: Occurs when the callback is being called. This callback is called when a command is sent through the server console, remote RCON, or via the in-game /rcon command.

member.name: E:SampSharp.GameMode.BaseMode.PlayerRequestSpawn
member.summary: Occurs when the callback is being called. Called when a player attempts to spawn via class selection.

member.name: E:SampSharp.GameMode.BaseMode.ObjectMoved
member.summary: Occurs when the callback is being called. This callback is called when an object is moved using or (when it stops moving).

member.name: E:SampSharp.GameMode.BaseMode.PlayerObjectMoved
member.summary: Occurs when the callback is being called. This callback is called when an object is moved using or (when it stops moving).

member.name: E:SampSharp.GameMode.BaseMode.PlayerPickUpPickup
member.summary: Occurs when the callback is being called. Called when a player picks up a pickup created with .

member.name: E:SampSharp.GameMode.BaseMode.VehicleMod
member.summary: Occurs when the callback is being called. This callback is called when a vehicle is modded.
member.remarks: This callback is not called by .

member.name: E:SampSharp.GameMode.BaseMode.PlayerEnterExitModShop
member.summary: Occurs when the callback is being called. This callback is called when a player enters or exits a mod shop.

member.name: E:SampSharp.GameMode.BaseMode.VehiclePaintjobApplied
member.summary: Occurs when the callback is being called. Called when a player changes the paintjob of their vehicle (in a modshop).

member.name: E:SampSharp.GameMode.BaseMode.VehicleResprayed
member.summary: Occurs when the callback is being called. The callback name is deceptive, this callback is called when a player exits a mod shop, regardless of whether the vehicle's colors were changed, and is NEVER called for pay 'n' spray garages.
member.remarks: Misleadingly, this callback is not called for pay 'n' spray (only modshops).

member.name: E:SampSharp.GameMode.BaseMode.VehicleDamageStatusUpdated
member.summary: Occurs when the callback is being called. This callback is called when a vehicle element such as doors, tires, panels, or lights get damaged.
member.remarks: This does not include vehicle health changes.

member.name: E:SampSharp.GameMode.BaseMode.UnoccupiedVehicleUpdated
member.summary: Occurs when the callback is being called. This callback is called everytime an unoccupied vehicle updates the server with their status.
member.remarks: This callback is called very frequently per second per unoccupied vehicle. You should refrain from implementing intensive calculations or intensive file writing/reading operations in this callback.

member.name: E:SampSharp.GameMode.BaseMode.PlayerSelectedMenuRow
member.summary: Occurs when the callback is being called. This callback is called when a player selects an item from a menu.

member.name: E:SampSharp.GameMode.BaseMode.PlayerExitedMenu
member.summary: Occurs when the callback is being called. Called when a player exits a menu.

member.name: E:SampSharp.GameMode.BaseMode.PlayerInteriorChanged
member.summary: Occurs when the callback is being called. Called when a player changes interior.
member.remarks: This is also called when is set.

member.name: E:SampSharp.GameMode.BaseMode.PlayerKeyStateChanged
member.summary: Occurs when the callback is being called. This callback is called when the state of any supported key is changed (pressed/released). Directional keys do not trigger this callback.

member.name: E:SampSharp.GameMode.BaseMode.RconLoginAttempt
member.summary: Occurs when the callback is being called. This callback is called when someone tries to login to RCON, succesful or not.
member.remarks: This callback is only called when /rcon login is used.

member.name: E:SampSharp.GameMode.BaseMode.PlayerUpdate
member.summary: Occurs when the callback is being called. This callback is called everytime a client/player updates the server with their status.
member.remarks: This callback is called very frequently per second per player, only use it when you know what it's meant for.

member.name: E:SampSharp.GameMode.BaseMode.PlayerStreamIn
member.summary: Occurs when the callback is being called. This callback is called when a player is streamed by some other player's client.

member.name: E:SampSharp.GameMode.BaseMode.PlayerStreamOut
member.summary: Occurs when the callback is being called. This callback is called when a player is streamed out from some other player's client.

member.name: E:SampSharp.GameMode.BaseMode.VehicleStreamIn
member.summary: Occurs when the callback is being called. Called when a vehicle is streamed to a player's client.

member.name: E:SampSharp.GameMode.BaseMode.VehicleStreamOut
member.summary: Occurs when the callback is being called. This callback is called when a vehicle is streamed out from some player's client.

member.name: E:SampSharp.GameMode.BaseMode.TrailerUpdate
member.summary: Occurs when the callback is being called. This callback is called when a player sent a trailer update.

member.name: E:SampSharp.GameMode.BaseMode.DialogResponse
member.summary: Occurs when the callback is being called. This callback is called when a player responds to a dialog shown using by either clicking a button, pressing ENTER/ESC or double-clicking a list item (if using a list style dialog).

member.name: E:SampSharp.GameMode.BaseMode.PlayerTakeDamage
member.summary: Occurs when the callback is being called. This callback is called when a player takes damage.

member.name: E:SampSharp.GameMode.BaseMode.PlayerGiveDamage
member.summary: Occurs when the callback is being called. This callback is called when a player gives damage to another player.
member.remarks: One thing you can do with GiveDamage is detect when other players report that they have damaged a certain player, and that player hasn't taken any health loss. You can flag those players as suspicious. You can also set all players to the same team (so they don't take damage from other players) and process all health loss from other players manually. You might have a server where players get a wanted level if they attack Cop players (or some specific class). In that case you might trust GiveDamage over TakeDamage. There should be a lot you can do with it. You just have to keep in mind the levels of trust between clients. In most cases it's better to trust the client who is being damaged to report their health/armour (TakeDamage). SA-MP normally does this. GiveDamage provides some extra information which may be useful when you require a different level of trust.

member.name: E:SampSharp.GameMode.BaseMode.PlayerClickMap
member.summary: Occurs when the callback is being called. This callback is called when a player places a target/waypoint on the pause menu map (by right-clicking).
member.remarks: The Z value provided is only an estimate; you may find it useful to use a plugin like the MapAndreas plugin to get a more accurate Z coordinate (or for teleportation; use ).

member.name: E:SampSharp.GameMode.BaseMode.PlayerClickTextDraw
member.summary: Occurs when the callback is being called. This callback is called when a player clicks on a textdraw or cancels the select mode(ESC).
member.remarks: The clickable area is defined by and .

member.name: E:SampSharp.GameMode.BaseMode.PlayerClickPlayerTextDraw
member.summary: Occurs when the callback is being called. This callback is called when a player clicks on a player-textdraw. It is not called when player cancels the select mode (ESC) - however, is.

member.name: E:SampSharp.GameMode.BaseMode.PlayerClickPlayer
member.summary: Occurs when the callback is being called. Called when a player double-clicks on a player on the scoreboard.
member.remarks: There is currently only one 'source' (). The existence of this argument suggests that more sources may be supported in the future.

member.name: E:SampSharp.GameMode.BaseMode.PlayerEditGlobalObject
member.summary: Occurs when the callback is being called. This callback is called when a player ends global object edition mode.

member.name: E:SampSharp.GameMode.BaseMode.PlayerEditPlayerObject
member.summary: Occurs when the callback is being called. This callback is called when a player ends player object edition mode.

member.name: E:SampSharp.GameMode.BaseMode.PlayerEditAttachedObject
member.summary: Occurs when the callback is being called. This callback is called when a player ends attached object edition mode.
member.remarks: Editions should be discarded if response was '0' (cancelled). This must be done by storing the offsets etc. in an array BEFORE using EditAttachedObject.

member.summary: A function that can be used in to enable or disable the players markers, which would normally be shown on the radar. If you want to change the marker settings at some other point in the gamemode, have a look at which does exactly that.
member.param: The mode you want to use.

member.name: M:SampSharp.GameMode.BaseMode.ShowNameTags(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Toggle the drawing of player name tags, health bars and armor bars above players.
member.param: False to disable, True to enable.

member.name: M:SampSharp.GameMode.BaseMode.UsePlayerPedAnimations
member.summary: Uses standard player walking animation (animation of CJ) instead of custom animations for every skin (e.g. skating for skater skins).

member.name: M:SampSharp.GameMode.BaseMode.EnableVehicleFriendlyFire
member.summary: Enable friendly fire for team vehicles.
member.remarks: Players will be unable to damage teammates' vehicles ( must be used!)

member.name: M:SampSharp.GameMode.BaseMode.SetNameTagDrawDistance(System.Single)
member.summary: Set the maximum distance to display the names of players.

member.name: M:SampSharp.GameMode.BaseMode.DisableInteriorEnterExits
member.summary: Disable all the interior entrances and exits in the game (the yellow arrows at doors).

member.name: M:SampSharp.GameMode.BaseMode.SetTeamCount(System.Int32)
member.summary: This function is used to change the amount of teams used in the game mode. It has no obvious way of being used, but can help to indicate the number of teams used for better (more effective) internal handling. This function should only be used in the callback.
member.remarks: You can pass 2 billion here if you like, this function has no effect at all.
member.param: Number of teams the gamemode knows.

member.name: M:SampSharp.GameMode.BaseMode.AddPlayerClass(System.Int32,SampSharp.GameMode.Vector3,System.Single,SampSharp.GameMode.Definitions.Weapon,System.Int32,SampSharp.GameMode.Definitions.Weapon,System.Int32,SampSharp.GameMode.Definitions.Weapon,System.Int32)
member.summary: Adds a class to class selection. Classes are used so players may spawn with a skin of their choice.
member.param: The skin which the player will spawn with.
The coordinate of the spawn point of this class.
The direction in which the player should face after spawning.
The first spawn-weapon for the player.
The amount of ammunition for the primary spawn weapon.
The second spawn-weapon for the player.
The amount of ammunition for the second spawn weapon.
The third spawn-weapon for the player.
The amount of ammunition for the third spawn weapon.
member.returns: The ID of the class which was just added. 300 if the class limit (300) was reached. The highest possible class ID is 299.

member.name: M:SampSharp.GameMode.BaseMode.ManualVehicleEngineAndLights
member.summary: Use this function before any player connects () to tell all clients that the script will control vehicle engines and lights. This prevents the game automatically turning the engine on/off when players enter/exit vehicles and headlights automatically coming on when it is dark.

member.remarks: See http://wiki.sa-mp.com/wiki/Keys.

member.name: F:SampSharp.GameMode.Definitions.Keys.Action
member.summary: The action key. (Default: Tab, onfoot. ALT GR / LCTRL / NUM 0, invehicle)

member.name: F:SampSharp.GameMode.Definitions.Keys.Crouch
member.summary: The crouch key. (Default: C, onfoot, H / CAPSLOCK, invehicle)

member.name: F:SampSharp.GameMode.Definitions.Keys.Fire
member.summary: The fire key. (Default: LCTRL / LMB, onfoot. LALT, invehicle)

member.name: F:SampSharp.GameMode.Definitions.Keys.Sprint
member.summary: The sprint key. (Default: SPACE, onfoot. W, invehicle)

member.name: F:SampSharp.GameMode.Definitions.Keys.SecondaryAttack
member.summary: Secondary attack key. (Default: ENTER, onfoot. ENTER, invehicle)

member.name: F:SampSharp.GameMode.Definitions.Keys.Jump
member.summary: Jump key. (Default: LSHIFT, onfoot)

member.name: F:SampSharp.GameMode.Definitions.Keys.LookRight
member.summary: Look right key. (Default: E, invehicle)

member.name: F:SampSharp.GameMode.Definitions.Keys.Handbrake
member.summary: Handbrake key. (Default: RMB, onfoot. SPACE, invehicle)

member.name: F:SampSharp.GameMode.Definitions.Keys.Aim
member.summary: Aim key. (Default: RMB, onfoot. SPACE, invehicle)

member.name: F:SampSharp.GameMode.Definitions.Keys.LookLeft
member.summary: Look left key. (Default: Q, invehicle)

member.name: F:SampSharp.GameMode.Definitions.Keys.Submission
member.summary: Submission key. (Default: NUM 1 / MMB, onfoot. 2 / NUM +, invehicle)

member.name: F:SampSharp.GameMode.Definitions.Keys.LookBehind
member.summary: Look behind key, look left + look right combined. (Default: NUM 1 / MMB, onfoot. 2, invehicle)

member.name: F:SampSharp.GameMode.Definitions.Keys.Walk
member.summary: Walk key. (Default: LALT, onfoot)

member.name: F:SampSharp.GameMode.Definitions.Keys.AnalogUp
member.summary: Analog up key. (Default: NUM 8)

member.name: F:SampSharp.GameMode.Definitions.Keys.AnalogDown
member.summary: Analog down key. (Default: NUM 2)

member.name: F:SampSharp.GameMode.Definitions.Keys.AnalogLeft
member.summary: Analog left key. (Default: NUM 4)

member.name: F:SampSharp.GameMode.Definitions.Keys.AnalogRight
member.summary: Analog right key. (Default: NUM 6)

member.name: F:SampSharp.GameMode.Definitions.Keys.Yes
member.summary: Yes key. (Default: Y)

member.name: F:SampSharp.GameMode.Definitions.Keys.No
member.summary: No key. (Default: N)

member.name: F:SampSharp.GameMode.Definitions.Keys.CtrlBack
member.summary: Controll back key. (Default: H)

member.summary: Represents the mathematical constant e(2.71828175).

member.summary: Represents the log base ten of e(0.4342945).

member.summary: Represents the log base two of e(1.442695).

member.summary: Represents the value of pi(3.14159274).

member.summary: Represents the value of pi divided by two(1.57079637).

member.summary: Represents the value of pi divided by four(0.7853982).

member.summary: Represents the value of pi times two(6.28318548).

member.name: M:SampSharp.GameMode.Helpers.MathHelper.Barycentric(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Returns the Cartesian coordinate for one axis of a point that is defined by a given triangle and two normalized barycentric (areal) coordinates.
member.param: The coordinate on one axis of vertex 1 of the defining triangle.
The coordinate on the same axis of vertex 2 of the defining triangle.
The coordinate on the same axis of vertex 3 of the defining triangle.
The normalized barycentric (areal) coordinate b2, equal to the weighting factor for vertex 2, the coordinate of which is specified in value2.
The normalized barycentric (areal) coordinate b3, equal to the weighting factor for vertex 3, the coordinate of which is specified in value3.
member.returns: Cartesian coordinate of the specified point with respect to the axis being used.

member.name: M:SampSharp.GameMode.Helpers.MathHelper.CatmullRom(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Performs a Catmull-Rom interpolation using the specified positions.
member.param: The first position in the interpolation.
The second position in the interpolation.
The third position in the interpolation.
The fourth position in the interpolation.
member.returns: A position that is the result of the Catmull-Rom interpolation.

member.name: M:SampSharp.GameMode.Helpers.MathHelper.Clamp(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Restricts a value to be within a specified range.
member.param: The minimum value. If value is less than min, min will be returned.
The maximum value. If value is greater than max, max will be returned.
member.returns: The clamped value.

member.name: M:SampSharp.GameMode.Helpers.MathHelper.Clamp(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Restricts a value to be within a specified range.
member.param: The minimum value. If value is less than min, min will be returned.
The maximum value. If value is greater than max, max will be returned.
member.returns: The clamped value.

member.name: M:SampSharp.GameMode.Helpers.MathHelper.Distance(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Calculates the absolute value of the difference of two values.
member.returns: Distance between the two values.

member.name: M:SampSharp.GameMode.Helpers.MathHelper.Hermite(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Performs a Hermite spline interpolation.
member.returns: The result of the Hermite spline interpolation.

member.name: M:SampSharp.GameMode.Helpers.MathHelper.Lerp(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Linearly interpolates between two values.
member.param: Value between 0 and 1 indicating the weight of value2.
member.returns: Interpolated value.
member.remarks: This method performs the linear interpolation based on the following formula. value1 + (value2 - value1) * amount Passing amount a value of 0 will cause value1 to be returned, a value of 1 will cause value2 to be returned.

member.summary: Returns the lesser of two values.

member.name: M:SampSharp.GameMode.Helpers.MathHelper.Min(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the lesser of two values.
member.returns: The lesser value.

member.name: M:SampSharp.GameMode.SAMP.Server.BlockIPAddress(System.String,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Blocks an IP address from further communication with the server for a set amount of time (with wildcards allowed). Players trying to connect to the server with a blocked IP address will receive the generic "You are banned from this server." message. Players that are online on the specified IP before the block will timeout after a few seconds and, upon reconnect, will receive the same message.
member.param:
The IP to block.
Wildcards can be used with this function, for example blocking the IP '6.9.*.*' will block all IPs where the first two octets are 6 and 9 respectively. Any number can be in place of an asterisk.
The time that the connection will be blocked for. 0 can be used for an indefinite block.

member.name: M:SampSharp.GameMode.SAMP.Server.UnBlockIPAddress(System.String)
member.summary: Unblock an IP address that was previously blocked using .

member.returns: The value of the server variable.

member.name: M:SampSharp.GameMode.SAMP.Server.GetTickCount

member.summary: Connect an NPC to the server.
member.param: The name the NPC should connect as. Must follow the same rules as normal player names.
The NPC script name that is located in the npcmodes folder (without the .amx extension).
member.returns: An instance of based on the first available player slot. If no slots are available, null.

member.name: E:SampSharp.GameMode.World.BasePlayer.TakeDamage
member.summary: Occurs when the is being called. This callback is called when a player takes damage.

member.name: E:SampSharp.GameMode.World.BasePlayer.GiveDamage
member.summary: Occurs when the is being called. This callback is called when a player gives damage to another player.
member.remarks: One thing you can do with GiveDamage is detect when other players report that they have damaged a certain player, and that player hasn't taken any health loss. You can flag those players as suspicious. You can also set all players to the same team (so they don't take damage from other players) and process all health loss from other players manually. You might have a server where players get a wanted level if they attack Cop players (or some specific class). In that case you might trust GiveDamage over TakeDamage. There should be a lot you can do with it. You just have to keep in mind the levels of trust between clients. In most cases it's better to trust the client who is being damaged to report their health/armour (TakeDamage). SA-MP normally does this. GiveDamage provides some extra information which may be useful when you require a different level of trust.

member.name: E:SampSharp.GameMode.World.BasePlayer.ClickMap
member.summary: Occurs when the is being called. This callback is called when a player places a target/waypoint on the pause menu map (by right-clicking).
member.remarks: The Z value provided is only an estimate; you may find it useful to use a plugin like the MapAndreas plugin to get a more accurate Z coordinate (or for teleportation; use ).

member.name: M:SampSharp.GameMode.World.BasePlayer.ApplyAnimation(System.String,System.String,System.Single,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Apply an animation to this .
member.remarks: The parameter, in most cases is not needed since players sync animations themselves. The parameter can force all players who can see this Player to play the animation regardless of whether the player is performing that animation. This is useful in circumstances where the player can't sync the animation themselves. For example, they may be paused.
member.param: The name of the animation library in which the animation to apply is in.
The name of the animation, within the library specified.
The speed to play the animation (use 4.1).
Set to True for looping otherwise set to False for playing animation sequence only once.
Set to False to return player to original x position after animation is complete for moving animations. The opposite effect occurs if set to True.
Set to False to return player to original y position after animation is complete for moving animations. The opposite effect occurs if set to True.
Will freeze the player in position after the animation finishes.
Timer in milliseconds. For a never ending loop it should be 0.
Set to True to force playerid to sync animation with other players in all instances

The speed to play the animation (use 4.1).

Set to False to return player to original x position after animation is complete for moving animations. The opposite effect occurs if set to True.
Set to False to return player to original y position after animation is complete for moving animations. The opposite effect occurs if set to True.
Will freeze the player in position after the animation finishes.
Timer in milliseconds. For a never ending loop it should be 0.

member.name: M:SampSharp.GameMode.World.BasePlayer.SetMapIcon(System.Int32,SampSharp.GameMode.Vector3,SampSharp.GameMode.Definitions.PlayerMarkersMode,SampSharp.GameMode.SAMP.Color,SampSharp.GameMode.Definitions.MapIconType)
member.summary: This function allows you to place your own icons on the map, enabling you to emphasize the locations of banks, airports or whatever else you want. A total of 63 icons are available in GTA: San Andreas, all of which can be used using this function. You can also specify the color of the icon, which allows you to change the square icon (ID: 0).
member.param: The player's icon ID, ranging from 0 to 99, to be used in .
The coordinates of the place where you want the icon to be.
The color of the icon, this should only be used with the square icon (ID: 0).
member.returns: True if it was successful, False otherwise (e.g. the player isn't connected).
